nodes.text: It was impressive work you did, getting the Scheria flying. Between you and me, I had my doubts.

Honestly? I did, too. You should've seen what the Scheria's interior looked like after a couple hundred years of pirate occupation. …Actually, I take that back. If you'd seen what I saw, you would never have wanted to set foot inside. Take it from me: the ship has been deloused from bow to stern, and every meter of her has been hosed down with industrial-grade disinfectant. This ship is clean enough to eat off of, I swear it.

branches.responseText: Respectfully, Dr. Murad, I couldn't care less how clean the ship is. I lost a friend today.
I can't believe Lady Arano is alive after all this time.
Clean is good. Spaceworthy is better. You sure the Scheria is ready for sale?

nodes.text:
Yes, Commander. I'm sorry… both for the flippancy of my tone and for what happened to your friend. I guess I'm just excited. It isn't every day that you get to introduce your crewmates to a ship you just rebuilt.

Oh, and Darius… I'm sorry about all the shouting back on Axylus. As it turns out, getting shot at by pirates puts me on edge. No hard feelings?

None at all. You got that beast flying while under fire, that entitles you to yell at me as much as you want. Hell, I'm used to it.

You too, Lord Madeira. I never imagined we'd be working together, but I'm glad to have the opportunity—welcome to the family.

As am I, Mr. Oliveira. Over the years of our exile, Lady Arano told me a great deal about you and your company—all of it good.

Even before the events of the coup, she knew about Markham's Marauders. Your assistance in her father's [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreFjaldr],Fjaldr]] campaign did not go unnoticed.

It was a job, Lord Madeira. We only did what High Lord Tamati paid us to do.

Still, it feels good to be appreciated, and to know that someone out there still remembers Commander Markham's name.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Rimward Periphery]</color> The Madeira family name has always been synonymous with wisdom and prosperity. I'm pleased to have you aboard, Alexander.
You'll be a welcome addition aboard the Argo, Lord Madeira.
Being remembered is the best that any mercenary can hope for.
This is all very heartwarming, but we need to get moving.

nodes.text:
I appreciate the welcome, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}… but I'm not sure that my family name stands for much of anything anymore.

With luck and your assistance, perhaps one day I will redeem it.

Now. The Restoration's next move will be the liberation of Panzyr, but we won't be ready to launch another attack until we've replaced the losses we incurred on Weldry. You'll have time before Lady Arano requires your service. I suggest that you put it to good use.

Thank you, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Speaking of which, you'll have some time to before Lady Arano is ready to move on Panzyr. She needs to consolidate our forces on Weldry and replace our losses with fresh volunteers.

You remember her orders: you are to sharpen your company and grow strong. You have some time before we require your services again. I suggest that you use it.

That's right, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}… and now, you have everything that you need to build your own legacy.

You remember Lady Arano's orders: while she prepares for our next major assault against the Directorate, you are to sharpen your company and grow strong. We have some time before we're ready to move. I suggest that you use it.

Of course, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Quite right.

You remember Lady Arano's orders: while you wait for her call, you are to sharpen your company and grow strong. We have some time before we're ready for the next assault. I suggest that you use it.

I'll get you a fresh batch of contracts to look over, {COMMANDER.FirstName}.

Exciting times, I've gotta say.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Loner]</color> "Exciting" doesn't begin to describe it. I'd rather get in a fistfight with an Atlas than bow and scrape to this "Directorate" of Espinoza's.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Exiled]</color> "Exciting" doesn't begin to describe it. This is like returning from exile all over again.
[Origin: Bankruptcy] "Exciting" doesn't begin to describe it. We've got a wealthy patron. For a company like ours, that's everything.
We'd better put that freedom to good use. It won't be long before Lady Arano comes calling.
How about it, Yang? You excited?

nodes.text: I'm right there with you, Boss. It's gonna feel damned good to spread our wings. Speaking of which, shouldn't we get a crew over to the Scheria before we send her off? There's an absolutely enormous Mech Bay in there, and some LosTek parts with my name written all over them.

Hey, great, we're all on the same page. Wonderful. Speaking of which, shouldn't we get a crew over to the Scheria before we send her off? There's an absolutely enormous Mech Bay in there, and some LosTek parts with my name written all over them.

No, it won't. So let's quit talking and go explore the new ship! Before Lady Arano sells it off, I mean. There's an absolutely enormous Mech Bay in there, and some LosTek parts with my name written all over them.

Yeah, Boss. I'm practically giddy. So why the hell are we still hanging around here talking? There's an absolutely enormous Mech Bay in that new ship, and some LosTek parts with my name written all over them we can lay our hands on before Lady Arano sells it off.

I'm sure she reached out as soon as she could, Commander.

Oh, and Darius… I'm sorry about all the shouting back on Axylus. As it turns out, getting shot at by pirates puts me on edge. No hard feelings?

Oh, absolutely. I mean, she's here, isn't she? All the way from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLyreton],Lyreton]], with nary a decompression event in sight. Don't worry, Commander. I wouldn't endanger Lady Arano's spacers by putting them on an unsafe ship. I've got professional standards to maintain.

Oh, and Darius… I'm sorry about all the shouting back on Axylus. As it turns out, getting shot at by pirates puts me on edge. No hard feelings?
